results.title: Whistle down the wind
results.creator_credit: Bryan Forbes, Richard Attenborough and Beaver Films
results.brief_description: Based on Mary Hayley Bell’s popular novel, this is a charming and thoughtful study of the fragile nature of childhood trusts and beliefs. Hayley Mills and Alan Bates give excellent performances in this story of three innocent children who find a fugitive from the law in their barn and believe that he is Jesus. Produced by award-winning Richard Attenborough, this film is a poignant unveiling of the children’s gradual understanding of the truth, which will delight adults and children alike.

results.title: The Goodbye girl
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Neil Simon’s fast-paced romance set in New York City revolves around the life of Paula McFadden (Marcia Mason) and her precocious daughter Lucy (Quinn Cummings). Recently abandoned by her boyfriend, Paula soon discovers that their apartment has been sublet to Elliot Garfield, a confident and self-obsessed actor from Chicago preparing for his New York debut (Richard Dreyfuss in an Academy Award performance). As Elliot arrives to claim the apartment the hate-at-first-sight pair strike an uneasy compromise that has explosive consequences.

results.title: Take the money and run
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe and Palomar Pictures International
results.brief_description: Woody Allen stars, directs and co-authors this satire of all the prison dramas, chain gang eposes and true crime movies. It is basically a running gag about hero Virgil Starkwell, a master criminal who always bungles the crime (even one as simple as breaking into a gumball machine!), and ends up with more time in gaol than in his pursuit of crime. Full of Allen’s wry, dry wit this is one to delight the buffs and break the funny bone.

results.title: Map of the human heart (D)
results.creator_credit: Vincent Ward, Tim Bevan and Vincent Ward Films
results.brief_description: New Zealander Vincent Ward’s third film is an immensely ambitious and audacious love story spanning 30 years and two continents. Much of it is set and filmed above the Arctic Circle in northern Canada, providing breathtaking scenery. Some journeys have no map to guide them. This is an epic voyage from a kingdom of ice to a world on fire. It is the magical story of Avik and Albertine and a love that survived decades, impossible distances and the ravages of war.

results.title: A Taxing woman's return
results.creator_credit: Juzo Itami, Yasushi Tamaoki and Itami Productions
results.brief_description: A follow uo to his comedy film “A Taxing woman”, Itami satirises the collapse of traditional values in Japan since World War II. Ryoko Hakura, the resourceful tax inspector inspired by the american “Colombo”, takes on the financial labyrinthe constructed by a jaded leader of a fraudulent religious cult collaborating with politicians, banks, big business; all held together by organised crime. This is a world peopled with “off-centre” characters who possess a gammut of short comings, cleverly satirised. The pace of the film is frantic; the plot, an intricate blend of comedy and action.

results.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
results.creator_credit: James Foley, Jerry Tokofsky, Stanley R Zupnik and Zupnik Enterprises
results.brief_description: In response to poor sales figures, a consulting salesman offers an incentive to a group of Chicago real-estate salesmen. The agent with the most sales at the end of the month wins a Cadillac, second prize is a set of steak knives, third prize is the sack!! Now more than ever the pressure is on to perform and the salesmen are desperate to do anything to hold on to their jobs… even robbery, extortion and embezzlement. David Mamet’s moving screenplay (based on his play) focuses on the dilemmas of the various salesmen desperate to keep their jobs who sustain themselves by reliving past glories. Stars an ensemble of fine actors including Al Pacino, Jack Lemmon, Alec Baldwin, Ed Harris and Alan Arkin.

results.title: I heard the owl call my name
results.brief_description: Father Brian (Tom Courtenay), a young Anglican priest, is unaware that he is dying of leukemia when he begins a mission into the majestic solitude of British Columbia. Sharing the joys and sorrows of a once proud Indian tribe, Father Brian learns enough of life to be ready to die, peacefully and with dignity. So when, on a cold and wintry evening he hears the owl call his name, he is prepared. In what is, without doubt, a simple yet powerful tale, Tom Courtenay’s stunning performance as a man doomed to die, is both touching and dramatic. The film rates as one of those rare presentations that packs a dramatic wallop that is not easily forgotten. Based on Margaret Craven’s novel of the same title.

results.title: The Mambo kings
results.creator_credit: Arne Glimcher, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, La Studia Canal, Regency Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: It is the early fifties and with a suitcase full of songs and hearts full of passion, two brothers leave Cuba and come to America in search of their Dream. They start a band and play the Mambo, Samba and Cha-cha in a nightclub every night. This is the story of their quest for show business fame based on the Pulitzer Prize winning “The Mambo Kings play Songs of Love” by Oscar Hjuelos. This film abounds with exciting Latin American music and fascinating footage of the “I Love Lucy” show is matched with footage of the brothers when their big break arrives. Stars Armand Assante and Antonio Banderas.

results.title: The Stolen children = Il Ladro di bambini
results.creator_credit: Gianni Amelio, Angelo Rizzoli, Alia Film, Erre Produzioni and Raidue
results.brief_description: Two children, Rosetta and Giusseppe are victims of a child prostitution ring. After their mother is arrested, they are taken by Antonio the Carabiniere from the North to the South of Italy, looking for an orphanage that will take the children. The children have learned to trust no-one, not even each other, yet this journey with Antonio begins to break down the barriers that the children have always had to maintain. This very special, rewarding film was the winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1992 Cannes Film Festival and has been universally hailed as one of the finest Italian films released in many years. Stars Enrico Lo Verso, Valentina Scalici and Giuseppe Ieracitano.

results.title: Everybody's fine = Stanno tutti bene
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Angelo Rizzoli, ERRE, Les Films Ariane, Sovereign Pictures and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description: Matteo Scuri (Marcello Mastroianni) is a gentle warm-hearted widower and the proudest father of all in Italy. With his five children all successes in their own right, Matteo can’t help but boast about them to everyone he meets - including strangers! For years his children, scattered throughout Italy, have paid an annual visit on his birthday. But this year, they are unable to make it. Disappointed and feeling a little lost, Matteo decides to pay his children a surprise visit, and reunite them all for another family celebration. As he crosses a noisy and crazy country, the trip becomes a revelation as he discovers the real lives of the children he thought he knew. A chronicle of one man’s haunting journey of discovery, this film touches all emotions - a truly captivating cinematic experience from director Giuseppe Tornatore. English subtitles.
